.2s ease;width:20px;z-index:100}.wp-lightbox-container button:focus-visible{outline:3px auto #5a5a5a40;outline:3px auto -webkit-focus-ring-color;outline-offset:3px}.wp-lightbox-container button:hover{cursor:pointer;opacity:1}.wp-lightbox-container button:focus{opacity:1}.wp-lightbox-container button:focus,.wp-lightbox-container button:hover,.wp-lightbox-container button:not(:hover):not(:active):not(.has-background){background-color:#5a5a5a40;border:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay{box-sizing:border-box;cursor:zoom-out;height:100vh;left:0;overflow:hidden;position:fixed;top:0;visibility:hidden;width:100%;z-index:100000}.wp-lightbox-overlay .close-button{align-items:center;cursor:pointer;display:flex;justify-content:center;min-height:40px;min-width:40px;padding:0;position:absolute;right:calc(env(safe-area-inset-right) + 16px);top:calc(env(safe-area-inset-top) + 16px);z-index:5000000}.wp-lightbox-overlay .close-button:focus,.wp-lightbox-overlay .close-button:hover,.wp-lightbox-overlay .close-button:not(:hover):not(:active):not(.has-background){background:none;border:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay .lightbox-image-container{height:var(--wp--lightbox-container-height);left:50%;overflow:hidden;position:absolute;top:50%;transform:translate(-50%,-50%);transform-origin:top left;width:var(--wp--lightbox-container-width);z-index:9999999999}.wp-lightbox-overlay .wp-block-image{align-items:center;box-sizing:border-box;display:flex;height:100%;justify-content:center;margin:0;position:relative;transform-origin:0 0;width:100%;z-index:3000000}.wp-lightbox-overlay .wp-block-image img{height:var(--wp--lightbox-image-height);min-height:var(--wp--lightbox-image-height);min-width:var(--wp--lightbox-image-width);width:var(--wp--lightbox-image-width)}.wp-lightbox-overlay .wp-block-image figcaption{display:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay button{background:none;border:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay .scrim{background-color:#fff;height:100%;opacity:.9;position:absolute;width:100%;z-index:2000000}.wp-lightbox-overlay.active{animation:turn-on-visibility .25s both;visibility:visible}.wp-lightbox-overlay.active img{animation:turn-on-visibility .35s both}.wp-lightbox-overlay.show-closing-animation:not(.active){animation:turn-off-visibility .35s both}.wp-lightbox-overlay.show-closing-animation:not(.active) img{animation:turn-off-visibility .25s both}@media (prefers-reduced-motion:no-preference){.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.active{animation:none;opacity:1;visibility:visible}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.active .lightbox-image-container{animation:lightbox-zoom-in .4s}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.active .lightbox-image-container img{animation:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.active .scrim{animation:turn-on-visibility .4s forwards}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.show-closing-animation:not(.active){animation:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.show-closing-animation:not(.active) .lightbox-image-container{animation:lightbox-zoom-out .4s}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.show-closing-animation:not(.active) .lightbox-image-container img{animation:none}.wp-lightbox-overlay.zoom.show-closing-animation:not(.active) .scrim{animation:turn-off-visibility .4s forwards}}@keyframes turn-on-visibility{0%{opacity:0}to{opacity:1}}@keyframes turn-off-visibility{0%{opacity:1;visibility:visible}99%{opacity:0;visibility:visible}to{opacity:0;visibility:hidden}}@keyframes lightbox-zoom-in{0%{transform:translate(calc((-100vw + var(--wp--lightbox-scrollbar-width))/2 + var(--wp--lightbox-initial-left-position)),calc(-50vh + var(--wp--lightbox-initial-top-position))) scale(var(--wp--lightbox-scale))}to{transform:translate(-50%,-50%) scale(1)}}@keyframes lightbox-zoom-out{0%{transform:translate(-50%,-50%) scale(1);visibility:visible}99%{visibility:visible}to{transform:translate(calc((-100vw + var(--wp--lightbox-scrollbar-width))/2 + var(--wp--lightbox-initial-left-position)),calc(-50vh + var(--wp--lightbox-initial-top-position))) scale(var(--wp--lightbox-scale));visibility:hidden}}
</style>

:root :where(.wp-block-image figcaption){color:#555;font-size:13px;text-align:center}.is-dark-theme :root :where(.wp-block-image figcaption){color:#ffffffa6}.wp-block-image{margin:0 0 1em}
</style>

</style>

var(--wp--preset--color--luminous-vivid-amber) !important;}.has-light-green-cyan-color{color: var(--wp--preset--color--light-green-cyan) !important;}.has-vivid-green-cyan-color{color: var(--wp--preset--color--vivid-green-cyan) !important;}.has-pale-cyan-blue-color{color: var(--wp--preset--color--pale-cyan-blue) !important;}.has-vivid-cyan-blue-color{color: <script>
	// Rotate through announcements
	(() => {
		const announcements = document.getElementsByClassName('js-announcement'),
		      length = announcements.length,
			  intervalLength = 4000
		var count = 1
		// Only rotate if more than one
		if ( length > 1 ) setInterval(switchAnnouncements, intervalLength)

		function switchAnnouncements() {
			for (let i = 0; i < announcements.length; i++) {
				// If the next slide prepare to show
				if ( i === count ) {
					announcements[i].classList.remove('hidden')
					announcements[i].classList.add('opacity-0')
				// Otherwise prepare to hide
				} else {
					announcements[i].classList.add('opacity-0')
				}
			}
			// Delay to allow fade transition before setting to display: none
			setTimeout(() => {
			for (let i = 0; i < announcements.length; i++) {
				// If the next slide show
				if ( i === count ) {
					announcements[i].classList.remove('opacity-0')
				// Otherwise hide
				} else {
					announcements[i].classList.add('hidden')
					announcements[i].classList.remove('opacity-0')
				}
			}

			// If reached the end reset to first slide
			if (count === (length - 1 )) {
				count = 0
			// Otherwise move to the next slide
			} else {
				count++
			}

			}, '500')
		 }
	})();
</script>

<script>
	// Hide banner persitently if close button clicked, store setting in cookie
	(() => {
		const announcementBar = document.cookie.split("; ").find((row) => row.startsWith("announcement_closed="))?.split("=")[1];
		const announcementBarElement = document.getElementById('announcement-bar');
		if (announcementBar === 'true') {
			announcementBarElement.style.display = 'none';
			document.querySelector('#page').style = '--banner-height: 0px';
		} else {
			const site = document.querySelector('#page');
			site.style = `--banner-height: ${announcementBarElement.offsetHeight}px`;
		}
	})();
</script>


    <nav class="navbar navbar-expand-lg bg-gray-80">
        <div class="container h-full relative">

            <a class="navbar-brand ml-5 mr-6 lg:ml-0 lg:mr-8" href="https://sysdig.com/" rel="home">
                <img src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sysdig-logo-new-white.svg" alt="Sysdig" width="180" height="65" class="mb-0 " loading="eager">            </a>

                            <button class="navbar-toggler" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#navbarNavDropdown" aria-controls="navbarNavDropdown" aria-expanded="false" aria-label="Toggle navigation">
                    <svg width="41" height="41" viewBox="0 0 41 41" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                        <line class="line-1" x1="7.98535" y1="12.9167" x2="32.2108" y2="12.9167" stroke="#ffffff"
                              stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round"/>
                        <line class="line-2" x1="7.98535" y1="20.152" x2="32.2108" y2="20.152" stroke="#ffffff"
                              stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round"/>
                        <line class="line-3" x1="7.98535" y1="27.3873" x2="32.2108" y2="27.3873" stroke="#ffffff"
                              stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round"/>
                    </svg>
                </button>

                <div class="collapse navbar-collapse" id="navbarNavDropdown">
                    
                    <div class="navbar-modal-wrap">

                        <div class="nav-modal-header lg:hidden text-white flex items-center justify-between ml-5 mr-4 mt-2 mb-2">
                            <a class="navbar-brand w-20" href="https://sysdig.com/" rel="home"><img src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sysdig-logo-new-white.svg" alt="Sysdig" width="180" height="65" class="mb-0 " loading="eager"></a>

                            <button type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#navbarNavDropdown" aria-controls="navbarNavDropdown" aria-expanded="false" aria-label="Toggle navigation"
                                    class="button-clear text-white bg-transparent text-4xl leading-tight p-0" style="z-index: 1001;">
                                <span aria-hidden="true" class="block -mt-1">×</span>
                            </button>
                        </div>

</li>
	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-93994" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3"><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>About Sysdig<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-93993" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-93995" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="/about/" id="menu-item-dropdown-93995"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Who We Are<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>

</li>

	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-94006" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3  border_left   is-feature-card link-parent flex flex-col items-start justify-center"><a class="nav-link depth-1 border_left  is-feature-card link-parent flex flex-col items-start justify-center" href="/customers/bigcommerce/" id="menu-item-dropdown-94006"><img width="350" height="197" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-customer-350x197.jpg" class="nav-feature-img mb-4 rounded-xl " alt="" decoding="async" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-customer-350x197.jpg 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-customer-175x99.jpg 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-customer.jpg 600w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 350px) 100vw, 350px" />Customer Spotlight<span></span></span><div class="nav-description pt-1">BigCommerce achieves real-time cloud security</div><div class="flex justify-start text-link text-primary mt-3 -ml-3"></div></a></li>

<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55187" class="is-language-dropdown menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item dropdown"><a id="menu-item-dropdown-55187" class="nav-link flex items-center dropdown-toggle" role="button" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false"><img src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/themes/sysdig/assets/images/globe-white.svg" /> <div class="sr-only ml-1">Languages</div><span></span></a>
<ul class="dropdown-menu flex-col lg:flex-row flex-nowrap px-5 pt-2 pb-6 lg:px-7 lg:py-10 " aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-55187" role="menu">
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="mobile-back d-flex d-lg-none pb-4 pt-3"><a href="#" class="d-flex items-center">Back</a></li><li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="mobile-nav-column-header d-inline-flex d-lg-none pb-4 w-auto text-white">Language</li>	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55188" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3  no-header "><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>Language Header &#8211; Hidden<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-55188" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55194" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://de.sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55194"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Deutsch<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55189" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-home nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55189"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">English<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55192" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://sysdig.es/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55192"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Español<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55190" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://fr.sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55190"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Français<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55191" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://it.sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55191"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Italiano<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55193" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://sysdig.jp/" id="menu-item-dropdown-55193"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">日本<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55172" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item dropdown"><a id="menu-item-dropdown-55172" class="nav-link flex items-center dropdown-toggle" role="button" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false">Log In<span></span></a>
<ul class="dropdown-menu flex-col lg:flex-row flex-nowrap px-5 pt-2 pb-6 lg:px-7 lg:py-10 " aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-55172" role="menu">
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="mobile-back d-flex d-lg-none pb-4 pt-3"><a href="#" class="d-flex items-center">Back</a></li><li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="mobile-nav-column-header d-inline-flex d-lg-none pb-4 w-auto text-white">Log In</li>	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55173" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3"><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>Monitor<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-55173" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57656" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.sysdigcloud.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57656" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">US-East<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57657" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://us2.app.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57657"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">US-West<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57658" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://eu1.app.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57658"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">EU-Central<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57659" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.au1.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57659"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">AWS-AP-Sydney<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-92926" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.in1.sysdig.com" id="menu-item-dropdown-92926"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">AWS-AP-South<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57660" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.us4.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57660"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">GCP-US-West<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55179" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3"><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>Secure<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-57660" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57661" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://secure.sysdig.com/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57661" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">US-East<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57662" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://us2.app.sysdig.com/secure/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57662" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">US-West<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57663" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://eu1.app.sysdig.com/secure/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57663" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">EU-Central<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57664" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.au1.sysdig.com/secure/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57664" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">AWS-AP-Sydney<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-92927" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.in1.sysdig.com/secure" id="menu-item-dropdown-92927"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">AWS-AP-South<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57665" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://app.us4.sysdig.com/secure/#/login" id="menu-item-dropdown-57665" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">GCP-US-West<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
	<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55185" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item pb-6 lg:pb-3  no-header "><div class="nav-column-header flex items-center md:flex-wrap md:items-start pb-4" aria-expanded="false"><span>Log In &#8211; 3rd Column Header &#8211; HIdden<span></span></span></div>
	<ul aria-labelledby="menu-item-dropdown-57665" role="menu">
		<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-57666" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item pb-3"><a class="nav-link depth-2" href="https://cx.sysdig.com/" id="menu-item-dropdown-57666" target="_blank"><div><div class="nav-text position-relative inline">Support<span class="gradient-border-no"></span></div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-55196" class="filter-get-demo menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item"><a id="menu-item-dropdown-55196" class="nav-link flex items-center  button " href="/request-a-demo/" target="_blank">Get Demo<span></span></a></li>
<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" id="menu-item-94954" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom nav-item lg:hidden  is-feature-card link-parent flex flex-col items-start justify-center"><a id="menu-item-dropdown-94954" class="nav-link flex items-start  border_left  is-feature-card link-parent flex flex-col items-start justify-center" href="/555-benchmark/"><img width="350" height="197" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-555-1-350x197.png" class="nav-feature-img mb-4" alt="" decoding="async" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-555-1-350x197.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-555-1-175x98.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/sd-nav-feature-555-1.png 600w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 350px) 100vw, 350px" />555 Benchmark<div class="nav-description pt-1">Detect and respond to cloud attacks faster than attackers can complete them</div><div class="flex justify-start text-link text-primary mt-3 -ml-3"></div><span></span></a></li>

                    </div> <!-- .navbar-modal-wrap -->
                </div> <!-- .navbar-collapse -->

                    </div>
    </nav>
</div>

	<div id="content" class="site-content"><div id="primary" class="content-area"><main id="main" class="site-main">
			
	<div class="c-v4-m1-hero o-section pb-12 md:pb-4
    ">

		<div class="o-container container">
			<div class="row">

								<div class="c-v4-m1-hero--main col-12 col-md-7 col-lg-8 pb-8 md:pb-0">
					<nav aria-label="breadcrumb"><ol class="breadcrumb"><li class="breadcrumb-item"><a href="https://sysdig.com/blog/">Back to Blog</a></li></ol></nav>
					<h1>RUBYCARP: A Detailed Analysis of  a Sophisticated Decade-Old  Botnet Group</h1>

					
											<div class="b-v4-block-container-author">
														By <a href="https://sysdig.com/blog/author/sysdig-threat-research-team/">Sysdig Threat Research Team</a> - APRIL 9, 2024						</div>
					
																	<div class="b-v4-block-container-topics">Topics: <a href='https://sysdig.com/topic/cloud-security/?terms=cloud-security&types=post'>Cloud Security</a>, <a href='https://sysdig.com/topic/threat-research/?terms=threat-research&types=post'>Threat Research</a></div>
					
					 

    <div class="flex items-center mb-6">
        <p class="font-medium text-sm mb-0 mr-0.5">SHARE:</p>

                    <a class="ml-2.5" style="max-width: 35px; max-height:35px;"
               href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https://sysdig.com/blog/rubycarp-romanian-botnet-group/" target="_blank">
                <img width="72" height="72" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/facebook-3-logo-1-1.png" class="w-full h-full" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" />            </a>
                    <a class="ml-2.5" style="max-width: 35px; max-height:35px;"
               href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&amp;url=https://sysdig.com/blog/rubycarp-romanian-botnet-group/" target="_blank">
                <img width="72" height="72" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/Vector-1-2.png" class="w-full h-full" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" />            </a>
                    <a class="ml-2.5" style="max-width: 35px; max-height:35px;"
               href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https://sysdig.com/blog/rubycarp-romanian-botnet-group/&amp;text=" target="_blank">
                <img width="256" height="256" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/twitter-x-logo-black-round-20851.svg" class="w-full h-full" alt="" decoding="async" loading="lazy" />            </a>
         

        
    </div><!-- b-v4-block-container-social-share -->

									</div>

				<div class="c-v4-m1-hero--lottie col-12 col-md-5 col-lg-4 d-flex">
					<div class="d-flex justify-center align-items-center w-100">
						<div class="b-v4-block-container-img md:mt-12">
							<img width="1521" height="797" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_17.png" class="attachment-full size-full" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" decoding="async" loading="lazy" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_17.png 1521w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_17-350x183.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_17-1170x613.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_17-768x402.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_17-175x92.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1521px) 100vw, 1521px" />						</div>
					</div>
				</div>

			</div>
		</div>
	</div>


	<div class="o-container container b-v4-block-container has-global-padding pb-12 md:pb-24">

	<div class="row justify-content-between">

						<style>
                    /* Use calculated var from announement bar script to calc top offset */
                    .c-nav-links {
                        top: calc(var(--navigation--height) + var(--banner-height, 0px));
                    }

                    .admin-bar .c-nav-links {
                        top: calc(32px + var(--navigation--height) + var(--banner-height, 0px));
                    }
				</style>

				<div id="nav-links-desktop"
				     class="c-nav-links b-v4-block-container-anchors-wrapper c-toc__wrapper col-12 relative sticky bg-white mb-2 mt-0">
					<div id="nav-links-desktop-content"
					     class="b-v4-block-container-anchors collapse show col-12 col-md-11">
						<p>content:</p>
													<a href="#attribution"
							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">Attribution</a>
													<a href="#whatis"
							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">What is RUBYCARP?</a>
													<a href="#how"
							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">How does RUBYCARP Operate?</a>
													<a href="#motivations"
							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">RUBYCARP’s Motivations</a>
													<a href="#conclusion"
							   class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-links">Conclusion</a>
											</div>

					<div class="b-v4-block-container-anchors-wrapper-heading flex justify-end items-center">
						<button type="button"
						        class="button-toggle p-0"
						        data-toggle="collapse"
						        data-target="#nav-links-desktop-content"
						        aria-expanded="true"
						        aria-controls="nav-links-desktop-content">
							<span class="open">Show Table of Contents +</span>
							<span class="close">Hide &minus;</span>
						</button>
					</div>
				</div>


				<div class="dropdown flex lg:hidden col-12 py-6">
					<a class="dropdown-toggle text-black px-5 py-2"
						 id="dropdownMenuButton"
						 data-toggle="dropdown"
						 aria-expanded="false"
						 data-flip="false"
						 data-offset="0, -20">Content</a>
					<div class="dropdown-menu px-4 pb-5 pt-8" aria-labelledby="dropdownMenuButton">
						<ul class="px-1">
															<li>
									<a href="#attribution">Attribution</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#whatis">What is RUBYCARP?</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#how">How does RUBYCARP Operate?</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#motivations">RUBYCARP’s Motivations</a>
								</li>
															<li>
									<a href="#conclusion">Conclusion</a>
								</li>
													</ul>
					</div>
				</div>
							
		
			<div class="col-12 col-lg-8 offset-lg-2">

				
				<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content has-global-padding is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained"><!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/loose.dtd">
<html><body><p><a href="https://sysdig.com/threat-research/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">The Sysdig Threat Research Team</a> (Sysdig TRT) recently discovered a long-running botnet operated by a Romanian threat actor group, which we are calling RUBYCARP. Evidence suggests that this threat actor has been active for at least 10 years. Its primary method of operation leverages a botnet deployed using a variety of public exploits and brute force attacks. This group communicates via public and private IRC networks, develops cyber weapons and targeting data, and uses its botnet for financial gain via cryptomining and phishing. This report explores how RUBYCARP operates and its motivations.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>



<p>RUBYCARP, like many threat actors, is interested in payloads that enable financial gain. This includes cryptomining, DDoS, and Phishing. We have seen it deploy a number of different tools to monetize its compromised assets. For example, through its Phishing operations, RUBYCARP has been seen targeting credit cards. As we have seen with other threat actors, it has a diversified set of illicit income streams.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="attribution">Attribution</h2>



<p>RUBYCARP, the name we have given this group, is a financially-motivated threat actor group that is most likely Romanian. RUBYCARP may be related to the <a href="https://www.alphatechs.al/post/outlaw-apt-group-evolution-of-tactics-from-cryptomining-to-phishing-and-spear-phishing" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Outlaw advanced persistent threat (APT)</a>, as it does share many of the same tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs). However, since these shared TTPs are common across many botnet operators, we cannot definitively make this conclusion. RUBYCARP leverages Shellbot often during its operations, which can also cause attribution confusion since this tool is a common choice among threat actors.&nbsp;</p>



<p>In the murky world of cybercriminal threat intelligence, there is often a lot of crossover in both tools and targeting. In the <a href="https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/cybersecurity-advisories/aa24-016a" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">recent advisory from CISA</a>, the Androxgh0st threat actor&rsquo;s choice to exploit Laravel is discussed. This is another example of cybercriminal overlap, with RUBYCARP notably targeting the same framework vulnerabilities. Many of these threat actors are fighting it out over the same target space, making it difficult to attribute attacks.&nbsp;</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="whatis">What is RUBYCARP?</h2>



<p>For months, Sysdig TRT&rsquo;s has been tracking RUBYCARP through the <strong>targeting and exploitation of Laravel applications vulnerable to </strong><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2021-3129" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"><strong>CVE-2021-3129</strong></a>. This led to evidence of SSH Brute forcing as another way the group gained access to its targets. Recently, we also discovered evidence of the threat actor targeting WordPress sites using dumps of usernames and passwords. RUBYCARP continues to add new exploitation techniques to its arsenal in order to build its botnets.&nbsp;</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_33.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="585" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_33-1170x585.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86095" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_33-1170x585.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_33-350x175.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_33-768x384.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_33-175x88.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_33.png 1200w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p>Once access is obtained, a backdoor is installed based on the popular Perl Shellbot. The victim&rsquo;s server is then connected to an IRC server acting as command and control, and joins the larger botnet. During RUBYCARP&rsquo;s reconnaissance phase, we found <a href="https://github.com/sysdig/TR-Blogs/tree/main/IoCs-blog/rubycarp" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">39 variants</a> of the Perl file (shellbot), but only eight were in VirusTotal. This means that only a few campaigns were previously detected. The modifications of the files are:</p>



<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>A nickname is used to join the IRC server&nbsp;</li>



<li>The channel where the victim joins is often marked by either a platform name (e.g., apache) or a member name (e.g., juice)</li>



<li>Sometimes auth is added</li>



<li>The IRC server</li>
</ul>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter size-large is-resized"><a href="https://sysdig.com/rsac2024/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="612" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/TRT-RSA-1170x612.png" alt="" class="wp-image-87988" style="width:625px;height:auto" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/TRT-RSA-1170x612.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/TRT-RSA-350x183.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/TRT-RSA-768x402.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/TRT-RSA-175x92.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/TRT-RSA.png 1200w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="campaigns">Campaigns</h3>



<p>After connecting to the IRC server, we discovered the actual number of compromised hosts at over 600. On the other hand, by not properly configuring the connection to the server, RUBYCARP has a detection system to kick out unexpected/unwanted users of the server and ban their IP to prevent new connections. It tries to keep the network hidden as much as possible.&nbsp;</p>



<p>The last active domain of this botnet is chat[.]juicessh[.]pro, and we were able to obtain the information below:</p>



<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>It was created on Monday, May 1, 2023 at 04:30:05 UTC</li>



<li>624 nicks [2 ops, 0 halfops, 0 voices, 622 normal]</li>



<li>VICTIMS by channel at the moment of writing:
<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>#juscan1, 176 victims</li>



<li>#cfs, 11 victims</li>



<li>#php3, 34 victims</li>



<li>#sb, 33 victims</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_11.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="1080" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_11-1170x1080.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86073" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_11-1170x1080.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_11-350x323.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_11-768x709.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_11-1536x1418.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_11-175x162.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_11.png 1588w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p>Based on naming schemes and connection configuration, the apparent group would be composed of users like &#8220;juice,&#8221; &#8220;cartier,&#8221; or &#8220;aridan,&#8221; but there could be more, where each one might be dedicated to a purpose, cryptomining, customized tools, etc. During our investigation, we determined that its IRC server of choice for public and private hosting is undernet.org. The active private IRC networks are <strong>chat[.]juicessh[.]pro</strong> and <strong>sshd[.]run</strong>.</p>



<p>The infrastructure we discovered for RUBYCARP is comprised of a significant number of malicious IPs and domains, rotated regularly and often replaced and emptied of its malicious content as soon as any potential research activity was detected. A full infrastructure list is available <a href="https://github.com/sysdig/TR-Blogs/tree/main/IoCs-blog/rubycarp" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">here</a>.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="how">How does RUBYCARP Operate?</h2>



<p>RUBYCARP uses multiple IRC networks for general communications, but also to manage its botnets and coordinate cryptomining campaigns. An outline of its organization when managing botnets would be as follows:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_12.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="585" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_12-1170x585.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86074" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_12-1170x585.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_12-350x175.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_12-768x384.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_12-175x88.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_12.png 1200w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p>In one of the logs we acquired, RUBYCARP tends to share the tools it is using, which include many of the tools we have been able to collect through our honeypot, such as:<br></p>



<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>Banner</li>



<li>Masscan</li>



<li>X (kernel module)</li>



<li>brute</li>
</ul>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="83" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22-1170x83.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86084" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22-1170x83.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22-350x25.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22-768x55.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22-1536x109.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22-175x12.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22-1930x137.png 1930w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_22.png 1956w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="comms">Communications</h3>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="private-irc">Private IRC</h4>



<p>For managing its botnet, RUBYCARP uses a collection of private IRC servers and seems to rotate them regularly. &ldquo;<strong>Juice.baselinux.net</strong>,&rdquo; &ldquo;<strong>chat.juicessh.pro</strong>,&rdquo; and others are the latest active ones at the time of writing. Each RUBYCARP campaign gets its own IRC channel and the bots within each channel are then named according to a predefined scheme. We were able to map the observed servers and their respective channels, although, unfortunately, not all of them are still active or accessible.&nbsp;</p>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="public-irc">Public IRC</h4>



<h5 class="wp-block-heading" id="members">Members</h5>



<p>Members of RUBYCARP mainly communicate through an Undernet IRC channel called <strong>#Cristi</strong>. Public <a href="https://netsplit.de/channels/details.php?room=%23Cristi&amp;net=Undernet" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">logs</a> for the channel show a user (and admin) &ldquo;<strong>_juice</strong>&rdquo; interacting with other members of the group in Romanian; we can also see that the channel topic is related to previous or current campaigns, available below.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="712" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9-1170x712.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86071" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9-1170x712.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9-350x213.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9-768x468.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9-1536x935.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9-175x107.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9-1930x1175.png 1930w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_9.png 1999w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p>While we monitored the chats, both actors, juice and Eugen, who own the channel <strong>#Eugen</strong> from which we collected most of the mining setup evidence, were present in channel #Cristi.</p>



<p>Within the user base of the channel #Cristi, which at the time of writing contained 280 users, we identified multiple familiar names of actors who attacked our honeypot. For example, &ldquo;Catalin&rdquo; attacked our honeypot on Jan. 8, 2024 from IP <strong>80[.]83[.]124[.]150</strong>. The following image is of the website hosted there at the time of the attack. Notice the attribution to &ldquo;Catalin&rdquo; at the bottom.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_16.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="592" height="625" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_16.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86078" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_16.png 592w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_16-350x370.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_16-175x185.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 592px) 100vw, 592px" /></a></figure>



<p>Another one is &ldquo;aridan,&rdquo; who we observed in previous attacks with the domain &ldquo;aridan.men.&rdquo;</p>



<p>The most recurring IRC admins we found within the Shellbot configuration files are &ldquo;juice,&rdquo; &ldquo;MUIE,&rdquo; and &ldquo;Smecher,&rdquo; who also each have their own respective channels for malicious operations. &ldquo;juice&rdquo; has been the most prolific in setting up new malicious Shellbot configurations, new servers, and new victim channels. Below is the WHOIS screenshot for the #Cristi channel members we&rsquo;ve identified:&nbsp;</p>



<p><strong>juice_, admin</strong></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_24.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="146" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_24-1170x146.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86086" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_24-1170x146.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_24-350x44.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_24-768x96.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_24-175x22.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_24.png 1177w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p><strong>Smecher, admin</strong></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_1.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="645" height="112" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_1.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86063" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_1.png 645w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_1-350x61.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_1-175x30.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 645px) 100vw, 645px" /></a></figure>



<p><strong>MUIE, admin</strong></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full is-resized"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_25.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="616" height="144" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_25.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86087" style="width:800px;height:auto" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_25.png 616w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_25-350x82.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_25-175x41.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 616px) 100vw, 616px" /></a></figure>



<p><strong>Aridan, member</strong></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_28.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1060" height="187" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_28.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86090" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_28.png 1060w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_28-350x62.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_28-768x135.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_28-175x31.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1060px) 100vw, 1060px" /></a></figure>



<p><strong>Catalin, member</strong></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_5.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1120" height="163" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_5.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86067" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_5.png 1120w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_5-350x51.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_5-768x112.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_5-175x25.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1120px) 100vw, 1120px" /></a></figure>



<p><strong>Dog, developer</strong></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_18.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="801" height="127" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_18.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86080" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_18.png 801w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_18-350x55.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_18-768x122.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_18-175x28.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 801px) 100vw, 801px" /></a></figure>



<h4 class="wp-block-heading" id="community"><br>Community</h4>



<p>We identified a custom script that is plausibly circulated among the group members on how to set up the juice mining operation. It then lists the <strong>#redhat</strong> channel hosted on undernet for support. This channel has no official relation to RedHat the business or software, and is likely just a nod to redhat vigilante hacking.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_8.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="901" height="321" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_8.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86070" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_8.png 901w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_8-350x125.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_8-768x274.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_8-175x62.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 901px) 100vw, 901px" /></a></figure>



<p>The redhat channel uses the <a href="https://undernet.org/servers.php" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">undernet IRC network</a>. Specifically, this group uses the Romanian server <strong>bucharest.ro.eu.undernet[.]org</strong>, where the username @juice_ is present.&nbsp;</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_19.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="352" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_19-1170x352.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet grou" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86081" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_19-1170x352.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_19-350x105.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_19-768x231.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_19-175x53.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_19.png 1291w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p>The channel #Cristi is used to set up mining operations and keeps track of the members utilizing the custom malicious tools we encountered, often signed by &ldquo;Juice&rdquo; and &ldquo;Cartier&rdquo; (aka &ldquo;dog&rdquo; and &ldquo;Kartier&rdquo;) group members.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_34.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="167" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_34-1170x167.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86096" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_34-1170x167.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_34-350x50.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_34-768x110.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_34-175x25.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_34.png 1267w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p>Within the channel #Cristi logs we were able to scrape, we found a reference to an external link&nbsp; <a href="http://physics.uctm.edu/funis/eugen" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">http://physics.uctm.edu/funis/eugen</a>. To our surprise, it contained quite an extensive record of logs taken from the private channel #Eugen, which we had not seen before. </p>



<p>By investigating what we had found, we quickly discovered that the two people involved in most of the interactions within these logs were user &ldquo;Kartier&rdquo; (signed as &ldquo;dog&rdquo;) and &ldquo;Eugen.&rdquo; Both members were present, at different times, in the channel #Cristi. &ldquo;Eugen&rdquo; seems to be a moniker for a Romanian individual who also conducts malicious operations alongside the other members, as the logs containing their own miner setups attest.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="91" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15-1170x91.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86077" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15-1170x91.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15-350x27.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15-768x60.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15-1536x120.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15-175x14.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15-1930x151.png 1930w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_15.png 1999w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="30" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3-1170x30.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86065" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3-1170x30.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3-350x9.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3-768x20.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3-1536x40.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3-175x5.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3-1930x50.png 1930w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_3.png 1999w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a><figcaption class="wp-element-caption">Link to the #Eugen channel logs found in #Cristi</figcaption></figure>



<p>The main domain where these logs are currently saved belongs to a legitimate Bulgarian University, the University of Chemical Technology and Metallurgy. The subdomain <strong>physics.uctm[.]edu</strong> appears to be compromised by RUBYCARP and contains detailed instructions and information on the tools used and the miner configuration.</p>



<p>We&rsquo;ve identified the user &ldquo;dog&rdquo; as the main malicious tool developer of the group, signing their tools with &ldquo;Cartier&rdquo; and &ldquo;Kartier.&rdquo;&nbsp; We have also found direct evidence of tool developer, &ldquo;Cartier,&rdquo; within the channel #Cristi, as shown below.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="395" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13-1170x395.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86075" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13-1170x395.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13-350x118.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13-768x259.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13-1536x519.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13-175x59.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13-1930x652.png 1930w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_13.png 1999w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p>Dog&rsquo;s tool expertise is reflected in the way it instructs other members of the group how to set up and run the custom malicious tools. These malicious tools have been found in almost all of the campaigns we were targeted in. This list includes:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="338" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20-1170x338.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86082" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20-1170x338.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20-350x101.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20-768x222.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20-1536x444.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20-175x51.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20-1930x558.png 1930w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_20.png 1999w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p>Here, user &ldquo;Eugen&rdquo; shows running miners, bash, and ld-linux-x8:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_4.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1101" height="235" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_4.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86066" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_4.png 1101w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_4-350x75.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_4-768x164.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_4-175x37.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1101px) 100vw, 1101px" /></a></figure>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_2.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="994" height="136" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_2.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86064" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_2.png 994w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_2-350x48.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_2-768x105.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_2-175x24.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 994px) 100vw, 994px" /></a></figure>



<p>There is also a reference to malicious ELF &ldquo;plm,&rdquo; observed multiple times in attacks against our honeypot and also <a href="https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/d6258555b44f217b818d8f96d9b63be7dea367d793e1eb7ac3312019d7b81c47" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">reported in past campaigns</a>:</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_27.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="580" height="76" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_27.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86089" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_27.png 580w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_27-350x46.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_27-175x23.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 580px) 100vw, 580px" /></a></figure>



<p>Below, there is an excerpt of how user &ldquo;dog&rdquo; is attempting to give access to user &ldquo;Eugen&rdquo; to a malicious domain containing a setup script for its infrastructure.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_29.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="829" height="771" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_29.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86091" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_29.png 829w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_29-350x326.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_29-768x714.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_29-175x163.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 829px) 100vw, 829px" /></a></figure>



<p>The IP above corresponds to a malicious indicator on <a href="https://www.virustotal.com/gui/ip-address/188.165.166.18/detection" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">VirusTotal</a>, identified as malware.</p>



<p>There are also references to RUBYCARP&rsquo;s most commonly used tool, Mass Scanner (masscan), a tool omnipresent within its pre-exploitation activities and utilized to find new potential victims.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_21.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1162" height="577" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_21.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86083" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_21.png 1162w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_21-350x174.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_21-768x381.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_21-175x87.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1162px) 100vw, 1162px" /></a></figure>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="motivations">RUBYCARP&rsquo;s Motivations</h2>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="cryptomining">Cryptomining</h3>



<p>RUBYCARP uses its own pools for mining that are hosted on the same domains where it has created the IRC server to control the bots. These custom mining pools allow it to avoid detection from IP-based blocklists, and the usage of common and random ports provides another layer of stealth from simple detection systems. We&rsquo;ve also discovered that it has not focused on a single cryptocurrency or mining tool but, instead, has several miners and wallets with activity. All the following IoCs are related to the &ldquo;juice&rdquo; threat actor.</p>



<p>Mining Pools:&nbsp;</p>



<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>juicessh[.]space:443</li>



<li>juicessh[.]space:4430</li>



<li>juicessh[.]space:5332</li>



<li>91[.]208.206.118:443</li>



<li>194[.]163.141.243:4430</li>



<li>sshd[.]baselinux[.]net</li>



<li>run[.]psybnc[.]org:443</li>
</ul>



<p>Known miners</p>



<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>NanoMiner</li>



<li>XMrig</li>
</ul>



<p>Cryptocurrencies</p>



<ul class="wp-block-list">
<li>Monero</li>



<li>Ethereum</li>



<li>Ravencoin</li>
</ul>



<p>The Ravencoin wallet has been particularly prolific. From a <a href="https://api.ravencoin.org/address/RLXGcK53hXFzsFnFBCAPistLTnvoTMUpzS" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">wallet checker</a>, its total amount in USD would be over $22,800 received. The wallet has a large number of transactions associated with it and has been active since February 2022, and the last available transaction was mined on March 12, 2024.</p>



<p>There are also several exchanges of wallet information among the members, in an attempt to show how much they have gained from these malicious campaigns. In the excerpt below, user &ldquo;porno&rdquo; claimed to have gained 0.00514903 BTC, around $360 USD, within 24 hours.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_14.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="853" height="174" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_14.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86076" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_14.png 853w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_14-350x71.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_14-768x157.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_14-175x36.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 853px) 100vw, 853px" /></a></figure>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="c3bash">C3Bash</h3>



<p>On top of the already known miners we observed above, we also encountered a custom command-line miner set up called simply &ldquo;miner,&rdquo; which we named &ldquo;C3Bash&rdquo; due to the self-labeling we found. The script in question is signed by &ldquo;Juice&rdquo; and it allows a potential user to set up its wallet address with a command line argument, as well as any miner of choice.&nbsp;</p>



<p>Once the user has set up its configurations, the script takes care of downloading, installing, and running the miners in the background, also alerting the user if the script gets killed by an antivirus or simply removed. It also suggests what the CPU usage should be compared to the host, probably to avoid detection. On a victim device, this may result in the running of multiple miners at the same time, effectively reducing both the time it takes for the attacker to execute the malicious payload and the chances of it being detected, as the execution will now rely on a single script.&nbsp;</p>



<p>The script at the moment supports miners XMRig/Monero, and the script itself was hosted on a now-dead domain &ldquo;<strong>download[.]c3bash[.]org</strong>.&rdquo;</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_7.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1158" height="285" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_7.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86069" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_7.png 1158w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_7-350x86.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_7-768x189.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_7-175x43.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1158px) 100vw, 1158px" /></a></figure>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="phishing">Phishing</h3>



<p>We found evidence that RUBYCARP also executes phishing operations to steal financially valuable assets, such as credit card numbers. Based on logs, it appears that it is using this to fund its infrastructure but it is reasonable to think RUBYCARP also uses these for other purposes, or possibly to sell.&nbsp;</p>



<p>In one of the attacks we received against our honeypot in December 2023, we identified a phishing template (letter.html) targeting Danish users and impersonating the Danish logistics company <a href="https://www.bring.dk/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">&ldquo;Bring.&rdquo;</a></p>



<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_26.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="673" height="415" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_26.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86088" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_26.png 673w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_26-350x216.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_26-175x108.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 673px) 100vw, 673px" /></a></figure>



<p>We also discovered a PHP script, named &ldquo;<code>ini.inc</code>,&rdquo; used to send those phishing emails. An email.txt file was found that contained two potential compromised email accounts from which the attackers would send emails: &ldquo;test@lufaros[.]com&rdquo; and &ldquo;maria@cenacop[.]com.&rdquo; At the time of this writing, the domain &ldquo;lufaros[.]com&rdquo; is marked as Malicious on <a href="https://www.virustotal.com/gui/domain/lufaros.com" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">VirusTotal</a>.</p>



<p>Analyzing the shellbot code shows that it has specific commands to send emails, and it is likely that this is the template used in the campaigns:</p>



<p><em><code>sendraw($IRC_cur_socket, "PRIVMSG $printl :!u sendmail &lt;subject&gt; &lt;sender&gt; &lt;recipient&gt; &lt;message&gt;");<br></code></em><br>We identified 36 text files containing hundreds of Danish email addresses, some of which were present in both old and recent data leaks. It is reasonable to think that the email addresses may have been the target of the phishing template shown above.<br><br>Within the same data, we also identified a Zip file named &ldquo;<strong>remote_code.zip</strong>.&rdquo; Once extracted, the archive contains a logo image of the European bank <a href="https://www.nets.eu/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Nets</a>. Within the same folder, there are also SVG files containing an &ldquo;ID Check&rdquo; verification image and a Visa logo. More images were also found containing a mobile phone layout, as shown below, effectively emulating a Nets home banking application. These would be used to build a convincing phishing landing page.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_23.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="805" height="399" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_23.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86085" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_23.png 805w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_23-350x173.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_23-768x381.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_23-175x87.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 805px) 100vw, 805px" /></a><figcaption class="wp-element-caption">Archives</figcaption></figure>



<figure class="wp-block-table"><table class="table table-bordered table-auto has-border-color has-white-border-color"><tbody><tr><td><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="250" height="383" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86092" style="width: 250px;" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_30.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_30.png 483w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_30-350x536.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_30-175x268.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 250px) 100vw, 250px" /></td><td><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="250" height="155" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86093" style="width: 250px;" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_31.png" alt="RUBYCARP botnet group" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_31.png 535w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_31-350x217.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_31-175x108.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 250px) 100vw, 250px" /></td></tr></tbody></table><figcaption class="wp-element-caption">Archive content</figcaption></figure>



<p>Finally, we also found direct evidence of a new domain purchase. In an excerpt below, it is possible to see how the user &ldquo;dog&rdquo;/&rdquo;cartier&rdquo; is preparing to purchase a new potential domain with stolen credit card data.&nbsp;</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1999" height="752" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86068" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6.png 1999w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6-350x132.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6-1170x440.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6-768x289.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6-1536x578.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6-175x66.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_6-1930x726.png 1930w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1999px) 100vw, 1999px" /></a></figure>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_32.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="709" height="364" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_32.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86094" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_32.png 709w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_32-350x180.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_32-175x90.png 175w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 709px) 100vw, 709px" /></a></figure>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_10.png"><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" width="1170" height="121" src="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_10-1170x121.png" alt="" class="img-lightbox wp-image-86072" srcset="https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_10-1170x121.png 1170w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_10-350x36.png 350w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_10-768x80.png 768w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_10-1536x159.png 1536w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_10-175x18.png 175w, https://sysdig.com/wp-content/uploads/RUBYCARP_10.png 1651w, / 1w" sizes="(max-width: 1170px) 100vw, 1170px" /></a></figure>



<p><br>The screenshot above shows a conversation where user &ldquo;dog&rdquo; lists files which we believe it has stolen. The filenames seem a clear reference to Swedish bank <a href="https://www.swish.nu/about-swish" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Swish</a>, and the timestamp in the filenames suggests they may have been stolen in 2016. &ldquo;Dog&rdquo; also provided credit card information to be used, presumably, by other members. These were printed in clear text within the channel, and have been redacted as they contained payment information.</p>



<p>Given the evidence above, it is plausible that the attackers may rely on phishing templates to collect payment information. It is safe to assume the phishing targets European entities, such as Swish Bank, Nets Bank, and Bring Logistics, among others.</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading" id="conclusion">Conclusion</h2>



<p>RUBYCARP is a group of Romanian threat actors who have been active for almost a decade. Attribution is always difficult, but they are most likely Romanian and may have some crossover with the &ldquo;Outlaw APT&rdquo; group and others who leverage the Perl Shellbot. These threat actors are also involved in the development and sale of cyber weapons, which isn&rsquo;t very common. They have a large arsenal of tools they have built up over the years which gives them quite a range of flexibility when conducting their operations.</p>



<p>Communications between threat actors hasn&rsquo;t changed very much over the years, with IRC still being very popular. There is also a community aspect to RUBYCARP which is interesting, as they help mentor people who are new to the scene. This does provide some financial benefits to the group since it can then sell them the toolset that it has made.&nbsp;</p>



<p>While RUBYCARP targets known vulnerabilities and conducts brute force attacks, what makes it more dangerous is its post-exploitation tools and the breadth of its capabilities (i.e., Phishing). Defending against this group requires diligent vulnerability management, a robust security posture, and runtime threat detection.&nbsp;</p>
</body></html>
</div>			</div>

							<div class="col-12">
				<div class="wp-block-rb-pathfactory-concierge">
					<div id="pf-concierge"></div>
				</div>
			</div>

<li itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="https://www.schema.org/SiteNavigationElement" class="not-link menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-has-children nav-item"><span>Social</span>
